results.name: Array T, read by descending diagonals: T(n, k) = k*(2*n + k + 1)/2 for n, k >= 0.
comment: Triangle S(n,k) = T(k, n-k), read by rows, is given by S(n,k) = A000217(n) - A000217(k) for n >= 0 and 0 <= k <= n. - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 07 2013 [Edited by _Petros Hadjicostas_, Nov 20 2019]
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: S(n,k) = n*(n+1)/2 - k*(k+1)/2 for n >= 0 and 0 <= k <= n - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 07 2013 [Edited by _Petros Hadjicostas_, Nov 20 2019]
G.f. for S(n,k): x*(1 - x^2*y)/((1 - x*y)^2*(1 - x)^3). - _Petros Hadjicostas_, Dec 14 2019
example: Rectangular array T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k >= 0) begins as follows:
Triangle S(n, k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k >= 0) begins as follows:
program: for(n=0, 15, for(k=0,n, print1(T(k,n-k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 12 2019
(Sage) [[(n-k)*(n+k+1)/2 for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..15)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 12 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([0..15], n-> List([0..n], k-> (n-k)*(n+k+1)/2 ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 12 2019
xref: Diagonal sums are in A000330. See also A049777 (triangle without the zeros).
